00032 class Quadric {
00034     friend std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream&, const Quadric& );
00035 public:
00036     typedef std::pair<bool, double> HitAndDist;
00037 
00038     // Intersect will determine if the particle at Postion and Direction
00039     // will intersect with the surface.  It returns a std::pair HitAndDist
00040     // It assumes that the PosSense defines whether the particles thinks it
00041     // has a positive sense with respect to the surface
00042     virtual HitAndDist intersect(const std::vector<double>& position, 
00043                                  const std::vector<double>& direction,
00044                                  bool PosSense) const = 0;
00045 
00047     virtual Quadric* clone() const = 0;
00048 
00050     // sense to this quadric without doing all the distance calcs
00051     virtual bool hasPosSense(const std::vector<double>& position) const = 0;
00052 
00053     // NOTE: this must be public if we ever have a generic Quadric
00054     virtual ~Quadric() {
00055 //        cout << "Oh no, I (quadric " << this << ") am dying!" << endl;
00056         /* * */
00057     }
00058 
00059 protected:
00060     Quadric() { /* * */ }
00061 
00062     bool _hasPosSense(const double eval) const;
00063     HitAndDist _calcQuadraticIntersect( double A, double B, double C,
00064             bool posSense ) const;
00065 
00067     virtual std::ostream& _output( std::ostream& os ) const = 0;
00068 };
00069 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00070 
00071 // Defining this function here gives us the ability to make the same decision 
00072 // for all Quadric surfaces in one place.
00073 inline bool Quadric::_hasPosSense(const double eval) const{
00074     // Positive sense includes points "on" the surface (i.e. includes zero)
00075     // negative sense if the evaluated is strictly less than zero
00076     return ( eval >= 0 );
00077 }
00078 
00079 inline Quadric::HitAndDist Quadric::_calcQuadraticIntersect(
00080         double A, double B, double C, bool posSense) const
00081 {
00082     bool particleHitsSurface = false;
00083     double distanceToIntercept = -1.0;
00084 
00085     double Q = B*B - A*C;
00086 
00087     if (Q < 0) {
00088         particleHitsSurface = false;
00089         distanceToIntercept = 0.0;
00090     } 
00091     else {
00092         if (not posSense) { //inside the surface (negative orientation)
00093             if (B <= 0) {   // headed away from the surface
00094                 if (A > 0) {    // surface is curving upward
00095                     particleHitsSurface = true;
00096                     distanceToIntercept = (std::sqrt(Q) - B)/A;
00097                 } 
00098                 else {  // surface curving away and headed in, never hits it
00099                     particleHitsSurface = false;
00100                     distanceToIntercept = 0.0;
00101                 }
00102             } 
00103             else {  // particle is heading toward the surface
00104                 particleHitsSurface = true;
00105                 distanceToIntercept = std::max(0.0, -C/(std::sqrt(Q) + B));
00106             }
00107         } 
00108         else {  // particle is outside
00109             if (B >= 0) {   // particle headed away
00110                 if (A >= 0) {
00111                     particleHitsSurface = false;
00112                     distanceToIntercept = 0.0;
00113                 } 
00114                 else {
00115                     particleHitsSurface = true;
00116                     distanceToIntercept = -(std::sqrt(Q) + B)/A;
00117                 }
00118             } 
00119             else {
00120                 particleHitsSurface = true;
00121                 distanceToIntercept = std::max(0.0, C/(std::sqrt(Q) - B));
00122             }
00123         }
00124     }
00125     Ensure( distanceToIntercept >= 0.0 );
00126 
00127     return std::make_pair(particleHitsSurface, distanceToIntercept);
00128 }
00129 
00130 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00132 // for polymorphism, we have to call a private inherited method
00133 inline std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& os, const Quadric& q)
00134 {
00135     return q._output(os);
00136 }
